Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Hollowman9000> I thought CMC was a simple application to fill out

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Hollowman9000> Or are there minimum volumes involved?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <CryptoAlex> @Hollowman9000 From CMC FAQ
The criteria for a cryptocurrency to be listed is the following:

- Must be a cryptocurrency or a crypto token.  (OK)
- Must be on a public exchange with an API that reports the last traded price and the last 24 hour trading volume. (DP is getting there, it seems)
- Must have a non-zero trading volume on at least one supported exchange so a price can be determined.  (OK)
- For market cap ranking, an accurate circulating supply figure is required. (OK)

If you'd like to have a cryptocurrency listed and it meets all of the criteria, please fill out the request form.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <wistar> @miketout : Ah, gawd. I actually know Matt Blaze from a long time ago (via his then girlfriend Jutta Degener). I am a little surprised at his broad brush denouncement.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <dukeleto> @miketout mostly looking to just spark discussion. Matt did help design ZeroCoin protocol, which evolved into Zcash protocol that KMD/VRSC/ZEC all have at their core. I agree about "blithe tweets" and also, he has probably earned the right to be blithe. He just ran a voting machine hacking event at DefCon, he is very deep into the now-and-here election technology world, and seems pretty jaded by fancy new technologies like blockchains/etc

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> i think when you're blasting real tech of real projects, gaining fame and then being blithe about your own failure to do something securely is irresponsible

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <dukeleto> actually, I confused him with Matt Green from Zerocoin protocol, oops

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> could be that and the centralized solutions that charge millions of $ to run an election on a private blockchain, where the software looks cool, but they are in as much control over the security as if they used Diebold machines. They gain ground because of ignorance and that ignorance obscuring even the existence of the problems to solve and the value of real solutions, just as scammers obscure blockchain benefits. claiming "all", as if he's an actual expert on the projects he doesn't take time to learn about just spreads ignorance and makes a real solution more difficult to discover and use. if he would make actual credible claims, like "I haven't seen" or "I would like to see" or "I'll give xxx in my challenge to see", then he might contribute value to the discussion

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> clipper chip - makes a little more sense now. it looks like he did good work on that, which earned his fame. would be nice to see him back up his current criticisms with a paper like that vs. blanket tweets

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> @miketout will it be possible to make privacy only assetchain with verushash ?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> https://docs.komodoplatform.com/komodo/assetchain-params.html#ac-private

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> we are already testing a test assetchain with privacy only chain, but I wonder if we can use verus algo instead of equihash

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> it's possible. i haven't ever tested it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> verushash isn't integrated into the main Komodo yet, and I'm just helping do it in CHIPS. if it was done in Komodo as a one off, without a proper merge, it would almost certainly make it much harder to get other tech moved over.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> we are testing it right now, if want to join us in #staked channel in KMD discord

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> I guess verus code must have the privacy ac params code in it ü§î

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> means the verucoin forked code

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> and if using verus komodod I want to make this privacy only chain, would love to know what will be the suitable params üôÇ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <dukeleto> @miketout @grewalsatinder I am happy to inform you both that -ac_private is already included in Verus master branch: https://github.com/VerusCoin/VerusCoin/commit/2f151c301925c9959d62d52a82d6ddcbe7971f00 and since -ac_private chains cant have any PoS, it's not compatible with Verus itself, and I am not sure if Verus asset chains will be 50/50 PoS or configurable, but in theory you should be able to use VerusHash + -ac_private together on a pure PoW chain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> so can specify verus 100% PoW ?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> if so can have a verushash PoW privacy only chain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> looked at the verusd script. if just copy it then a privacy only chain will have this command:
`./komodod -ac_name=ARRGH -ac_algo=verushash -ac_cc=1 -ac_supply=0 -ac_eras=3 -ac_reward=0,38400000000,2400000000 -ac_halving=1,43200,1051920 -ac_decay=100000000,0,0 -ac_end=10080,226080,0 -ac_timelockgte=19200000000 -ac_timeunlockfrom=129600 -ac_timeunlockto=1180800 -ac_veruspos=0 -ac_private=1`

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> üòÑ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> just changed pos to 0 and added privacy and renamed the name
-ac_veruspos=0 -ac_private=1
